cards.name: Mindmoil
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, put the cards in your hand on the bottom of your library in any order, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor:
"My criticism of the Izzet is that their impulse for learning seems too much like impulse and too little like learning."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

rulings.text: Whenever you cast a spell, Mindmoil's ability triggers. The ability will resolve before the spell does.
After Mindmoil's ability triggers, players may cast instants and activate activated abilities. Each time you cast an instant spell "in response," Mindmoil's ability triggers again.
After Mindmoil's ability resolves, but before the spell that triggered it does, you can cast instants from your new hand of cards. Each time you do, Mindmoil's ability triggers again.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a spell, put the cards in your hand on the bottom of your library in any order, then draw that many cards.

cards.name: Molten Sentry
cards.text: As Molten Sentry enters the battlefield, flip a coin. If the coin comes up heads, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 5/2 creature with haste. If it comes up tails, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 2/5 creature with defender.
cards.flavor: Some take after their father, Stone, some after their mother, Fire.

rulings.text: If a creature enters the battlefield copying Molten Sentry, that creature's controller flips a coin to see what the copy will be.
If a creature that's already on the battlefield copies Molten Sentry, it becomes a copy of whatever Molten Sentry already is (either a 5/2 creature with haste or a 2/5 creature with defender).

cards.originalText: As Molten Sentry comes into play, flip a coin. If the coin comes up heads, Molten Sentry comes into play as a 5/2 creature with haste. If it comes up tails, Molten Sentry comes into play as a 2/5 creature with defender.

cards.name: Ordruun Commando
cards.text: {W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ordruun Commando this turn.
cards.flavor: Thick of muscle, stout of heart, and possessing a burning love of justice and the battlefield, the Ordruun minotaurs are the foundation of the Boros Legion.
cards.originalText: {W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ordruun Commando this turn.

cards.name: Rain of Embers
cards.text: Rain of Embers deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: There's plenty to talk about in the marketplaces of Ravnica, be it the latest feud between guilds or the terrible weather.
cards.originalText: Rain of Embers deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Reroute
cards.text:
Change the target of target activated ability with a single target. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Three hundred years of practice thwarted by an instant of mischief.

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Change the target of target activated ability with a single target.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Sabertooth Alley Cat
cards.text:
Sabertooth Alley Cat attacks each combat if able.
{1}{R}: Creatures without defender can't block Sabertooth Alley Cat this turn.
cards.flavor: It has eight lives' worth of hunger to satisfy.

foreignNames.name: Chat de gouttière à dents de sabre

cards.originalText:
Sabertooth Alley Cat attacks each turn if able.
{1}{R}: Creatures without defender can't block Sabertooth Alley Cat this turn.

cards.name: Seismic Spike
cards.text: Destroy target land. Add {R}{R}.
cards.flavor: Natural disasters in Ravnica are largely nullified by the Izzet. Unnatural disasters, on the other hand, happen all of the time.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land. Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sell-Sword Brute
cards.text: When Sell-Sword Brute dies, it deals 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor: "Killing is easy. Just wrap your hand around the haft, and wrap your enemy around the blade."
cards.originalText: When Sell-Sword Brute is put into a graveyard from play, it deals 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Smash
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Ravnica's laws protect not its citizens but its industry. Aging equipment is destroyed rather than restored, to bring more money into the factories' coffers.
cards.originalText:
Destroy target artifact.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Sparkmage Apprentice
cards.text: When Sparkmage Apprentice enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Pajik was amazed and pleased at his newfound powers. His pet cat Rivin was slightly less enthusiastic.
cards.originalText: When Sparkmage Apprentice comes into play, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Stoneshaker Shaman
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, that player sacrifices an untapped land.
cards.flavor: There is no place in Ravnica for stagnation, no room for lands unfilled and untilled.

rulings.text: If the player doesn't have an untapped land as Stoneshaker Shaman's ability resolves, that player does nothing.

foreignNames.name: 石揺すりのシャーマン

cards.originalText: At the end of each player's turn, that player sacrifices an untapped land.

cards.name: Surge of Zeal
cards.text: Radiance — Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"If only my poxes were as infectious as their zealotry."
—Savra
cards.originalText: Radiance Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Torpid Moloch
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice three lands: Torpid Moloch loses defender until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Market hucksters sell molochs for use as watchdogs. Of course, that's all molochs do. Sit around . . . and watch.
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice three lands: Torpid Moloch loses defender until end of turn.

cards.name: Viashino Fangtail
cards.text: {T}: Viashino Fangtail deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"When the bony terminus gets too large, it's shed from the tail in coinciding periods of heightened aggression and hunger."
—Simic research notes

foreignNames.name: ヴィーアシーノの牙尾

cards.originalText: {T}: Viashino Fangtail deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Viashino Slasher
cards.text: {R}: Viashino Slasher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Citizens of Ravnica stick to the main streets. Shortcuts may look tempting, but down each alley, dozens of hungry hands await, and screams do not carry into the busy market throng.

foreignNames.name: ヴィーアシーノの斬鬼

cards.originalText: {R}: Viashino Slasher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Warp World
cards.text: Each player shuffles all permanents they own into their library, then reveals that many cards from the top of their library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of their library.

rulings.text: Anything that triggers during the resolution of this will wait to be put on the stack until everything is put onto the battlefield and resolution is complete. The player whose turn it is will put all of their triggered abilities on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order will do the same. (The last ability put on the stack will be the first one that resolves.)

Taking it slowly, here's what happens when Warp World resolves: 1) Each player counts the number of permanents they own. 2) Each player shuffles those permanents into their library. 3) Each player reveals cards from the top of their library equal to the number that player counted. 4) Each player puts all artifact, land, and creature cards revealed this way onto the battlefield. All of these cards enter the battlefield at the same time. 5) Each player puts all enchantment cards revealed this way onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way can enchant an artifact, land, or creature that was already put onto the battlefield, but can't enchant an enchantment that's being put onto the battlefield at the same time as it. If multiple players have Auras to put onto the battlefield, the player whose turn it is announces what their Auras will enchant, then each other player in turn order does the same, then all enchantments (both Auras and non-Auras) enter the battlefield at the same time. 6) Each player puts all of their other revealed cards (instants, sorceries, planeswalkers, and Auras that can't enchant anything) on the bottom of their library in any order.

Tokens are permanents but not cards. They'll count toward the number of permanents shuffled into your library, so you'll get a card back for each token you owned. But the tokens themselves should be ignored while you're revealing *cards* from your library. In practice, you shouldn't actually shuffle them into your library since they'll cease to exist as soon as Warp World finishes resolving. Note that a token's owner is the player under whose control it first entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Each player shuffles all permanents he or she owns into his or her library, then reveals that many cards from the top of his or her library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way into play, then puts all enchantment cards revealed this way into play, then puts the rest on the bottom of his or her library in any order.

cards.name: War-Torch Goblin
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice War-Torch Goblin: It deals 2 damage to target blocking creature.
cards.flavor:
"In a town shaped by the subtle machinations and political intrigue of its guilds, it's reassuring to see a goblin waving his torch and screaming about some nonsense or other."
—Agrus Kos
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice War-Torch Goblin: War-Torch Goblin deals 2 damage to target blocking creature.

cards.name: Wojek Embermage
cards.text: Radiance — {T}: Wojek Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.
cards.flavor: "Your brother's crimes are your crimes. You stood by and lent support, so you too must face judgment."

foreignNames.name: ウォジェクの燃えさし魔道士

cards.originalText: Radiance {T}: Wojek Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bramble Elemental
cards.text: Whenever an Aura becomes attached to Bramble Elemental, create two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
cards.flavor: Ravnica is a seamless urban tapestry, each city bleeding into the next. In abandoned corners, however, nature has begun to reclaim what it once owned.
cards.originalText: Whenever an Aura becomes attached to Bramble Elemental, put two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Carven Caryatid
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Carven Caryatid enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: So-called "old wood" is rare in deforested Ravnica. Statues carved from it are said to house the last of the ancient nature spirits.
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Carven Caryatid comes into play, draw a card.

cards.name: Chord of Calling
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The rules for convoke have changed slightly since it last appeared in an expansion. Previously, convoke reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under current rules, you tap creatures at the same time you pay the spell's costs. Tapping a creature this way is simply another way to pay.
Convoke doesn't change a spell's mana cost or converted mana cost.

When calculating a spell's total cost, include any alternative costs, additional costs, or anything else that increases or reduces the cost to cast the spell. Convoke applies after the total cost is calculated.
Because convoke isn't an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.
Tapping a multicolored creature using convoke will pay for {1} or one mana of your choice of any of that creature's colors.

When using convoke to cast a spell with {X} in its mana cost, first choose the value for X. That choice, plus any cost increases or decreases, will determine the spell's total cost. Then you can tap creatures you control to help pay that cost. For example, if you cast Chord of Calling (a spell with convoke and mana cost {X}{G}{G}{G}) and choose X to be 3, the total cost is {3}{G}{G}{G}. If you tap two green creatures and two red creatures, you'll have to pay {1}{G}.

If a creature you control has a mana ability with {T} in the cost, activating that ability while casting a spell with convoke will result in the creature being tapped when you pay the spell's costs. You won't be able to tap it again for convoke. Similarly, if you sacrifice a creature to activate a mana ability while casting a spell with convoke, that creature won't be on the battlefield when you pay the spell's costs, so you won't be able to tap it for convoke.

cards.originalText:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while playing this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)
Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost X or less and put it into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Civic Wayfinder
cards.text: When Civic Wayfinder enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "These alleys are not safe. Come, I can guide you back to the market square."
cards.originalText: When Civic Wayfinder comes into play, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Doubling Season
cards.text:
If an effect would create one or more tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.
If an effect would put one or more counters on a permanent you control, it puts twice that many of those counters on that permanent instead.

rulings.text: The tokens and counters that Doubling Season creates are exact copies of the kind of tokens and counters that were being created in the first place.
Doubling Season affects cards that "enter the battlefield with" a certain number of counters. Triskelion, for example, would enter the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it rather than three.

If there are two Doubling Seasons on the battlefield, then the number of tokens or counters is four times the original number. If there are three on the battlefield, then the number of tokens or counters is eight times the original number, and so on.

Planeswalkers will enter the battlefield with double the normal amount of loyalty counters. However, if you activate an ability whose cost has you put loyalty counters on a planeswalker, the number you put on isn't doubled. This is because those counters are put on as a cost, not as an effect.

cards.originalText:
If an effect would put one or more tokens into play under your control, it puts twice that many into play instead.
If an effect would place one or more counters on a permanent you control, it places twice that many on that permanent instead.

cards.name: Dowsing Shaman
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: He combs the streets looking for the lost light, the discarded enigmas of the city.

foreignNames.name: 占い棒使いのシャーマン

cards.originalText: {2}{G}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Dryad's Caress
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each creature on the battlefield. If {W} was spent to cast Dryad's Caress, untap all creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"I awoke to the face of beauty, my body fully healed. In that moment I knew my destiny was the Conclave's to shape."
—Rogad, Selesnya initiate

rulings.text: The spell checks on resolution to see if any mana of the stated color was spent to pay its cost. It doesn't matter how much mana of that color was spent.
If the spell is copied (such as with Twincast), the copy will never have had mana of the stated color paid for it, no matter what colors were spent on the original spell.

cards.originalText: You gain 1 life for each creature in play. If {W} was spent to play Dryad's Caress, untap all creatures you control.

cards.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
cards.text: {T}: Add {B}. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Cast out of the Conclave generations ago, these elves found a home in the corrupted districts of the Golgari.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Elvish Skysweeper
cards.text: {4}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The spires of Ravnica are no different from the tall trees of other planes. The elves navigate and protect them just the same.
cards.originalText: {4}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Farseek
cards.text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, or Mountain card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "How truly vast this city must be, that I have traveled so far and seen so much, yet never once found the place where the buildings fail."

rulings.text: The card can have other land types, including Forest, as long as it also has one of the listed land types.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, or Mountain card and put it into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Fists of Ironwood
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Fists of Ironwood enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
Enchanted creature has trample.
cards.flavor: Saprolings add the three and the four to the "one-two punch."

rulings.text: You create the Saproling tokens, even if Fists of Ironwood enters the battlefield attached to another player's creature.
The Saproling tokens aren't created until after Fists of Ironwood is on the battlefield, so you can't cast Fists of Ironwood on one of those tokens.
If the target creature is an illegal target when Fists of Ironwood tries to resolve, Fists of Ironwood won't resolve and won't enter the battlefield. You won't create Saproling tokens.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Fists of Ironwood comes into play, put two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play.
Enchanted creature has trample.

cards.name: Gather Courage
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The rules for convoke have changed slightly since it last appeared in an expansion. Previously, convoke reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under current rules, you tap creatures at the same time you pay the spell's costs. Tapping a creature this way is simply another way to pay.
Convoke doesn't change a spell's mana cost or converted mana cost.

When calculating a spell's total cost, include any alternative costs, additional costs, or anything else that increases or reduces the cost to cast the spell. Convoke applies after the total cost is calculated.
Because convoke isn't an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.
Tapping a multicolored creature using convoke will pay for {1} or one mana of your choice of any of that creature's colors.

When using convoke to cast a spell with {X} in its mana cost, first choose the value for X. That choice, plus any cost increases or decreases, will determine the spell's total cost. Then you can tap creatures you control to help pay that cost. For example, if you cast Chord of Calling (a spell with convoke and mana cost {X}{G}{G}{G}) and choose X to be 3, the total cost is {3}{G}{G}{G}. If you tap two green creatures and two red creatures, you'll have to pay {1}{G}.

If a creature you control has a mana ability with {T} in the cost, activating that ability while casting a spell with convoke will result in the creature being tapped when you pay the spell's costs. You won't be able to tap it again for convoke. Similarly, if you sacrifice a creature to activate a mana ability while casting a spell with convoke, that creature won't be on the battlefield when you pay the spell's costs, so you won't be able to tap it for convoke.

cards.originalText:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while playing this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Golgari Brownscale
cards.text:
When Golgari Brownscale is put into your hand from your graveyard, you gain 2 life.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: The first ability triggers when Golgari Brownscale returns to your hand from your graveyard for any reason, not just when you use its dredge ability.
Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
When Golgari Brownscale is put into your hand from your graveyard, you gain 2 life.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Golgari Grave-Troll
cards.text:
Golgari Grave-Troll enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Golgari Grave-Troll: Regenerate Golgari Grave-Troll.
Dredge 6 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly six cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: If an effect puts Golgari Grave-Troll onto the battlefield from your graveyard, Golgari Grave-Troll counts itself as one of the cards in your graveyard and gets a counter accordingly.
Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

foreignNames.name: ゴルガリの墓トロール

cards.originalText:
Golgari Grave-Troll comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Golgari Grave-Troll: Regenerate Golgari Grave-Troll.
Dredge 6

cards.name: Goliath Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: The glittering strands of its complex web catch everything from a buzzing gnat to a passing bloatdrake.
cards.originalText: Goliath Spider can block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Greater Mossdog
cards.text: Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Man's best fungus.

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.originalText: Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Hunted Troll
cards.text:
When Hunted Troll enters the battlefield, target opponent creates four 1/1 blue Faerie creature tokens with flying.
{G}: Regenerate Hunted Troll.

foreignNames.name: 狩り立てられたトロール

cards.originalText:
When Hunted Troll comes into play, put four 1/1 blue Faerie creature tokens with flying into play under target opponent's control.
{G}: Regenerate Hunted Troll.

cards.name: Ivy Dancer
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Her ivy locks are a remnant of the wooded wilds now lost to Ravnica forever.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Life from the Loam
cards.text:
Return up to three target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Return up to three target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Moldervine Cloak
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.

cards.name: Nullmage Shepherd
cards.text: Tap four untapped creatures you control: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: The shepherds work in secret, seeking out abominations against nature and returning them to earth and dust.
cards.originalText: Tap four untapped creatures you control: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Overwhelm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Let the song of Selesnya be heard above the rhythm of our thundering hordes!"

rulings.text: The rules for convoke have changed slightly since it last appeared in an expansion. Previously, convoke reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under current rules, you tap creatures at the same time you pay the spell's costs. Tapping a creature this way is simply another way to pay.
Convoke doesn't change a spell's mana cost or converted mana cost.

cards.name: Perilous Forays
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for a land card with a basic land type and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"This is the place? This map has got to be wrong . . . ."
—Svania Trul, wayfinder novice, last words

rulings.text: You may find any card with Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest on its type line. The land doesn't need to be a basic land, so you can find a land such as Overgrown Tomb or Tropical Island.

cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for a land card with a basic land type and put it into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Primordial Sage
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: For each creature that arrives in its audience, the sage imparts another piece of ancient wisdom for all to hear.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a creature spell, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Recollect
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
—Savra
cards.originalText: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Rolling Spoil
cards.text: Destroy target land. If {B} was spent to cast Rolling Spoil, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The shadow that fell over the grove was silent yet horribly alive, roiling with millions of tiny minions dedicated to the process of rot.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land. If {B} was spent to play Rolling Spoil, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Root-Kin Ally
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Tap two untapped creatures you control: Root-Kin Ally gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The rules for convoke have changed slightly since it last appeared in an expansion. Previously, convoke reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under current rules, you tap creatures at the same time you pay the spell's costs. Tapping a creature this way is simply another way to pay.
Convoke doesn't change a spell's mana cost or converted mana cost.

When calculating a spell's total cost, include any alternative costs, additional costs, or anything else that increases or reduces the cost to cast the spell. Convoke applies after the total cost is calculated.
Because convoke isn't an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.
Tapping a multicolored creature using convoke will pay for {1} or one mana of your choice of any of that creature's colors.

When using convoke to cast a spell with {X} in its mana cost, first choose the value for X. That choice, plus any cost increases or decreases, will determine the spell's total cost. Then you can tap creatures you control to help pay that cost. For example, if you cast Chord of Calling (a spell with convoke and mana cost {X}{G}{G}{G}) and choose X to be 3, the total cost is {3}{G}{G}{G}. If you tap two green creatures and two red creatures, you'll have to pay {1}{G}.

If a creature you control has a mana ability with {T} in the cost, activating that ability while casting a spell with convoke will result in the creature being tapped when you pay the spell's costs. You won't be able to tap it again for convoke. Similarly, if you sacrifice a creature to activate a mana ability while casting a spell with convoke, that creature won't be on the battlefield when you pay the spell's costs, so you won't be able to tap it for convoke.

cards.originalText:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while playing this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)
Tap two untapped creatures you control: Root-Kin Ally gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Scatter the Seeds
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Create three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
cards.flavor: From the seeds of faith, great forests grow.

cards.originalText:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while playing this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)
Put three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Scion of the Wild
cards.text: Scion of the Wild's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor: It has a hundred thousand extinctions to avenge.
cards.originalText: Scion of the Wild's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Siege Wurm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: The Rubblefield was once among the wealthiest districts in Ravnica. All it took was a single wurm to reduce it to ruins.

rulings.text: The rules for convoke have changed slightly since it last appeared in an expansion. Previously, convoke reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under current rules, you tap creatures at the same time you pay the spell's costs. Tapping a creature this way is simply another way to pay.

cards.name: Stone-Seeder Hierophant
cards.text:
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, untap Stone-Seeder Hierophant.
{T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: Her touch brings to bare stone what water and sun bring to rich soil.
cards.originalText:
Whenever a land comes into play under your control, untap Stone-Seeder Hierophant.
{T}: Untap target land.

cards.name: Sundering Vitae
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Centuries of wind, rain, and roots compressed into an instant of destruction: such is the power of Selesnya.

cards.originalText:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while playing this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Transluminant
cards.text: {W}, Sacrifice Transluminant: Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: "Forget yourself. Forget your city. Forget your homes, your families, the debts and obligations that hold you to this world."

rulings.text: If you use this ability during a turn's end phase, the chance to put "at end of turn"-triggered abilities on the stack has passed. You won't get the Spirit creature token until the beginning of the next end step.

cards.originalText: {W}, Sacrifice Transluminant: Put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying into play at end of turn.

cards.name: Trophy Hunter
cards.text:
{1}{G}: Trophy Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
Whenever a creature with flying dealt damage by Trophy Hunter this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Trophy Hunter.

rulings.text: The second ability checks whether a creature being put into a graveyard (a) currently has flying and (b) was dealt damage earlier this turn by Trophy Hunter. It doesn't matter whether Trophy Hunter dealt the damage that caused the creature to be destroyed, whether the damage from Trophy Hunter was dealt in combat or via its activated ability, or who controlled the creature.

cards.originalText:
{1}{G}: Trophy Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
Whenever a creature with flying dealt damage by Trophy Hunter this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Trophy Hunter.

cards.name: Ursapine
cards.text: {G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A friendly ursapine means a constant supply of sharp spears. An unfriendly one means a constant supply of small holes.
cards.originalText: {G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Vinelasher Kudzu
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Vinelasher Kudzu.
cards.flavor: It grows to hate you.
cards.originalText: Whenever a land comes into play under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Vinelasher Kudzu.

cards.name: Agrus Kos, Wojek Veteran
cards.text: Whenever Agrus Kos, Wojek Veteran attacks, attacking red creatures get +2/+0 and attacking white creatures get +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Lieutenant Kos has never met a group of recruits he could not inspire or a mob he could not quell.

rulings.text: Attacking creatures (including Agrus Kos) that are both red and white get +2/+2 until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: ウォジェクの古参兵、アグルス・コス

cards.originalText: Whenever Agrus Kos, Wojek Veteran attacks, attacking red creatures get +2/+0 and attacking white creatures get +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Autochthon Wurm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Trample
cards.flavor: The trainer awoke to begin the journey from the wurm's tail to its head. The sun was setting when she arrived.

rulings.text: The rules for convoke have changed slightly since it last appeared in an expansion. Previously, convoke reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under current rules, you tap creatures at the same time you pay the spell's costs. Tapping a creature this way is simply another way to pay.

cards.originalText:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while playing this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)
Trample

cards.name: Bloodbond March
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, each player returns all cards with the same name as that spell from their graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The Golgari support a vast army because death never ends its soldiers' service.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature spell is played, each player returns all cards with the same name as that spell from his or her graveyard to play.

cards.name: Boros Swiftblade
cards.text: Double strike
cards.flavor: When the Boros Legion attacks, swiftblades enter the fray first. They pick off the archers and mages, softening the enemy front before the flame-kin and giants go in.
cards.originalText: Double strike

cards.name: Brightflame
cards.text: Radiance — Brightflame deals X damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor:
"Let the pyres of the unbelievers light our way."
—Razia

rulings.text: You gain life equal to the total damage dealt by Brightflame to all creatures. You don't gain life for any damage that was prevented.
All creatures that share a color are affected, even your own.

A creature "shares a color" with any creature that is at least one of its colors. For example, a green-white creature shares a color with creatures that are green, white, green-white, red-white, black-green, and so on.
If it targets a colorless creature, it doesn't affect any other creatures. A colorless creature shares a color with nothing, not even other colorless creatures.
You check which creatures share a color with the target when the spell resolves.
Only one creature is targeted. If that creature leaves the battlefield or otherwise becomes an illegal target, the entire spell doesn't resolve. No other creatures are affected.

cards.originalText: Radiance Brightflame deals X damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Chorus of the Conclave
cards.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
As an additional cost to cast creature spells, you may pay any amount of mana. If you do, that creature enters the battlefield with that many additional +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: "We are many, yet one. We are separate in body, yet speak with a single voice. Join us in our chorus."

rulings.text: Chorus of the Conclave's ability works only while it's on the battlefield, so you can't use it to put +1/+1 counters on itself.
Chorus of the Conclave's ability applies to creature spells only as they're being cast. You can't pay mana to put counters on creatures being put onto the battlefield by an effect.

Chorus of the Conclave's ability combines well with the convoke mechanic, effectively letting you tap creatures to put +1/+1 counters on the creature with convoke that you're casting, if you choose to do so.

cards.originalText:
Forestwalk
As an additional cost to play creature spells, you may pay any amount of mana. If you do, that creature comes into play with that many additional +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Circu, Dimir Lobotomist
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a blue spell, exile the top card of target library.
Whenever you cast a black spell, exile the top card of target library.
Your opponents can't cast spells with the same name as a card exiled with Circu, Dimir Lobotomist.

rulings.text: The first two abilities target libraries, not players.
If you cast a blue and black spell, both of Circu's triggered abilities trigger. You can target two different libraries or target the same library twice.
Circu's last ability applies to all of its controller's opponents, not just the owner of the exiled card.
Circu's last ability doesn't prevent copies of the exiled cards from being cast because copies aren't cards.
If a split card is exiled this way, opponents can't cast either half of the split card.

foreignNames.name: ディミーアの脳外科医、シアクー

cards.originalText:
Whenever you play a blue spell, remove the top card of target library from the game.
Whenever you play a black spell, remove the top card of target library from the game.
Your opponents can't play nonland cards with the same name as a card removed from the game with Circu, Dimir Lobotomist.

cards.name: Clutch of the Undercity
cards.text:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Its controller loses 3 life.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Its controller loses 3 life.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Congregation at Dawn
cards.text: Search your library for up to three creature cards and reveal them. Shuffle your library, then put those cards on top of it in any order.
cards.flavor: "It is fitting that we meet in the first hour of light, for we are called by the Conclave to pierce a threat of darkness."

rulings.text: The order in which the cards are placed on top of the library isn't revealed.

cards.originalText: Search your library for up to three creature cards and reveal them. Shuffle your library, then put those cards on top of it in any order.

cards.name: Consult the Necrosages
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player draws two cards.
• Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: Dimir rank and file never see nor hear their guildmaster. All orders are given through mysterious necrosages who appear from the shadows, tersely toss out a command, and then melt into the darkness.
cards.originalText: Choose one Target player draws two cards; or target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Dark Heart of the Wood
cards.text: Sacrifice a Forest: You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"The soil here is rich with the rotting dead, and the sun's fingers barely penetrate the dark canopy. Plant our brethren here. This shall be our sanctuary."
—Savra
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Forest: You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Dimir Cutpurse
cards.text: Whenever Dimir Cutpurse deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card and you draw a card.
cards.flavor: Other guilds demand tolls from those who travel their territories, but not House Dimir. It takes its share secretly, one coin purse at a time.

foreignNames.name: ディミーアの巾着切り

cards.originalText: Whenever Dimir Cutpurse deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card and you draw a card.

cards.name: Dimir Doppelganger
cards.text: {1}{U}{B}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Dimir Doppelganger becomes a copy of that card, except it has this ability.
cards.flavor: "Fear not. Your life will not go unlived."

rulings.text: This creature becomes an exact copy of a copied card, except that it also has Dimir Doppelganger's activated ability. If it becomes a copy of a different creature card, the new copy will overwrite the old copy.

A permanent's ability that refers to cards the creature exiled (such as Sisters of Stone Death's third ability) only affects cards exiled by other abilities intrinsic to that permanent (such as Sisters of Stone Death's second ability). Suppose that (a) Dimir Doppelganger copies Arc-Slogger, (b) its "deal 2 damage" ability is activated, and then (c) it copies Sisters of Stone Death. Creatures exiled by Arc-Slogger's ability can't be returned with Sisters of Stone Death's ability.

foreignNames.name: ディミーアのドッペルゲンガー

cards.originalText: {1}{U}{B}: Remove target creature card in a graveyard from the game. Dimir Doppelganger becomes a copy of that card and gains this ability.

cards.name: Dimir Infiltrator
cards.text:
Dimir Infiltrator can't be blocked.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Dimir Infiltrator is unblockable.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Drooling Groodion
cards.text: {2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Golgari expand, yes, but I refuse to call their tainted creations 'growth.'"
—Veszka, Selesnya evangel

foreignNames.name: よだれ垂らしのグルーディオン

cards.originalText: {2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Firemane Angel
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Firemane Angel is in your graveyard or on the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
{6}{R}{R}{W}{W}: Return Firemane Angel from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: If Firemane Angel is put into your graveyard from the battlefield or returned from your graveyard to the battlefield during your upkeep before its triggered ability resolves, you won't gain 1 life.

cards.originalText:
Flying, first strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Firemane Angel is in your graveyard or in play, you may gain 1 life.
{6}{R}{R}{W}{W}: Return Firemane Angel from your graveyard to play. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Flame-Kin Zealot
cards.text: When Flame-Kin Zealot enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Boros soldiers are like a cache of bombs ready to explode, and the flame-kin light their fuses.

rulings.text: All creatures under your control when Flame-Kin Zealot's triggered ability resolves are affected, including Flame-Kin Zealot itself. Ones that come under your control or become creatures later in the turn are not.

cards.originalText: When Flame-Kin Zealot comes into play, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Glare of Subdual
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact or creature.
cards.flavor: The righteous light of Selesnya is channeled through the devout, striking out to blind the nonbelievers.
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact or creature.

cards.name: Glimpse the Unthinkable
cards.text: Target player puts the top ten cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"I am confident that if anyone actually penetrates our facades, even the most perceptive would still be fundamentally unprepared for the truth of House Dimir."
—Szadek
cards.originalText: Target player puts the top ten cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Golgari Germination
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: The Golgari don't bury their dead. They plant them.
cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control is put into a graveyard from play, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.

cards.name: Golgari Rotwurm
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Like corpse-worms through a carapace, rotwurms slide through the hollowed bones of the undercity.

foreignNames.name: ゴルガリの腐れワーム

cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Grave-Shell Scarab
cards.text:
{1}, Sacrifice Grave-Shell Scarab: Draw a card.
Dredge 1 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly one card from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: You may sacrifice Grave-Shell Scarab to pay for its first ability, then replace that draw using the Scarab's dredge ability. The result is that the top card of your library is put into your graveyard and Grave-Shell Scarab returns to your hand (after a brief trip to the graveyard).

cards.originalText:
{1}, Sacrifice Grave-Shell Scarab: Draw a card.
Dredge 1 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly one card from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Guardian of Vitu-Ghazi
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Vigilance
cards.flavor: It stands sentinel to the great City-Tree, home of the Selesnya Conclave.

rulings.text: The rules for convoke have changed slightly since it last appeared in an expansion. Previously, convoke reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under current rules, you tap creatures at the same time you pay the spell's costs. Tapping a creature this way is simply another way to pay.

For example, if you cast Chord of Calling (a spell with convoke and mana cost {X}{G}{G}{G}) and choose X to be 3, the total cost is {3}{G}{G}{G}. If you tap two green creatures and two red creatures, you'll have to pay {1}{G}.

If a creature you control has a mana ability with {T} in the cost, activating that ability while casting a spell with convoke will result in the creature being tapped when you pay the spell's costs. You won't be able to tap it again for convoke. Similarly, if you sacrifice a creature to activate a mana ability while casting a spell with convoke, that creature won't be on the battlefield when you pay the spell's costs, so you won't be able to tap it for convoke.

foreignNames.name: ヴィトゥ＝ガジーの守護者

cards.originalText:
Convoke (Each creature you tap while playing this spell reduces its cost by {1} or by one mana of that creature's color.)
Vigilance

cards.name: Lightning Helix
cards.text: Lightning Helix deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Though less well-known than its army of soldiers, the Boros Legion's mage-priests are as respected by the innocent as they are hated by the ghosts of the guilty.

rulings.text: If the chosen target is illegal when Lightning Helix tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

cards.originalText: Lightning Helix deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Loxodon Hierarch
cards.text:
When Loxodon Hierarch enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
{G}{W}, Sacrifice Loxodon Hierarch: Regenerate each creature you control.
cards.flavor: "I have lived long, and I remember how this city once was. If my death serves to bring back the Ravnica in my memory, then so be it."

rulings.text: The second ability sets up individual regeneration shields for each creature you control. They are each used up as necessary during the turn and wear off when the turn ends.

cards.originalText:
When Loxodon Hierarch comes into play, you gain 4 life.
{G}{W}, Sacrifice Loxodon Hierarch: Regenerate each creature you control.

cards.name: Mindleech Mass
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Mindleech Mass deals combat damage to a player, you may look at that player's hand. If you do, you may cast a nonland card in it without paying that card's mana cost.

rulings.text: The spell is cast during the resolution of Mindleech Mass's triggered ability. You may cast any nonland card in the player's hand, not just an instant card. This doesn't get around other prohibitions, such as "Cast this card only before attackers are declared."
You control the spell and, if it's an artifact, creature, or enchantment spell, you control the resulting permanent.
The card is cast from your opponent's hand, not yours.
You choose modes, pay additional costs, choose targets, etc. for the spell as normal when casting it. Any X in the mana cost will be 0. Alternative costs can't be paid.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Mindleech Mass deals combat damage to a player, you may look at that player's hand. If you do, you may play a nonland card in it without paying that card's mana cost.

cards.name: Moroii
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Touched by moroii"
—Undercity slang meaning "to grow old"
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Perplex
cards.text:
Counter target spell unless its controller discards their hand.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

rulings.text: If the spell's controller has no cards in their hand, that player can still choose to discard their hand and prevent the spell from being countered.

cards.originalText:
Counter target spell unless its controller discards his or her hand.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Phytohydra
cards.text: If damage would be dealt to Phytohydra, put that many +1/+1 counters on it instead.
cards.flavor:
"Look at this creature, so like the Conclave it serves. Cut one head and it grows two. Damage it and it flourishes."
—Veszka, Selesnya evangel

rulings.text: If another effect would prevent damage from being dealt to Phytohydra or replace it with something else, Phytohydra's controller chooses which effect to apply first.

If Phytohydra blocks or is blocked by a creature with first strike or double strike, Phytohydra will get the counters during the first-strike combat damage step before it deals its own combat damage during the second combat damage step.

cards.originalText: If damage would be dealt to Phytohydra, put that many +1/+1 counters on it instead.

cards.name: Pollenbright Wings
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, create that many 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, put that many 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Psychic Drain
cards.text: Target player puts the top X cards of their library into their graveyard and you gain X life.
cards.flavor:
"Gold can be reearned, goods restored. The moroii steal youth, more precious than either, and once gone, it's gone forever."
—Berta Suszat, civic healer
cards.originalText: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard and you gain X life.

cards.name: Putrefy
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"All matter, animate or not, rots when exposed to time. We merely speed up the process."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

rulings.text: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an artifact, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Rally the Righteous
cards.text: Radiance — Untap target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it. Those creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Yuri took up the ragged Boros banner, and his brethren, inspired by the act, followed him back into the fight.
cards.originalText: Radiance Untap target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it. Those creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Razia, Boros Archangel
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, haste
{T}: The next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control this turn is dealt to another target creature instead.
cards.flavor: Her sword burns with such brightness that foes avert their eyes and arrows divert their paths.

rulings.text: The 3 damage doesn't have to be from the same source, and it doesn't have to be all dealt at once. If only 2 damage is redirected, the next 1 damage will also be redirected.
If either target creature leaves the battlefield before damage is dealt, that damage won't be redirected. It doesn't matter if Razia leaves the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: ボロスの大天使、ラジア

cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance, haste
{T}: The next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control this turn is dealt to another target creature instead.

cards.name: Razia's Purification
cards.text: Each player chooses three permanents they control, then sacrifices the rest.
cards.flavor: Only the chosen ones are spared.

rulings.text: If a player doesn't control three permanents, that player chooses all the permanents they do control and doesn't sacrifice anything.
Players choose permanents in turn order around the table, then simultaneously sacrifice all permanents not chosen.

cards.originalText: Each player chooses three permanents he or she controls, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.name: Savra, Queen of the Golgari
cards.text:
Whenever you sacrifice a black creature, you may pay 2 life. If you do, each other player sacrifices a creature.
Whenever you sacrifice a green creature, you may gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Nature's most raw beauty is the circle: perfect in its continuance, with no break between death and life."

rulings.text: These abilities trigger specifically when you "sacrifice" a creature. They won't trigger when a creature is put into your graveyard for any other reason.
Savra itself doesn't let you sacrifice creatures, and you can't sacrifice them spontaneously. You must have another spell or ability that lets you sacrifice creatures.
Sacrificing a creature that's both black and green will make both abilities trigger. You may put them on the stack in whichever order you want.

foreignNames.name: ゴルガリの女王、サヴラ

cards.originalText:
Whenever you sacrifice a black creature, you may pay 2 life. If you do, each other player sacrifices a creature.
Whenever you sacrifice a green creature, you may gain 2 life.

cards.name: Searing Meditation
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {2}. If you do, Searing Meditation deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"When I meditate I see the world as it should be. All that does not fit, I remove."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

rulings.text: Searing Meditation doesn't care how much life you gain. It triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it's 1 life from Firemane Angel or 15 life from Brightflame.

cards.originalText: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {2}. If you do, Searing Meditation deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Seeds of Strength
cards.text:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Beneath the beauty of light and seed is the might of Vitu-Ghazi.

rulings.text: You may choose the same creature as a target multiple times since the card says "target creature" multiple times. You may give three different creatures +1/+1 each, one creature +2/+2 and another creature +1/+1, or a single creature +3/+3.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Selesnya Evangel
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: "The clamor of the city drowns all voices. But together we can sing a harmony that will resonate from Ravnica's tallest spires to her deepest wells."
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.

cards.name: Selesnya Sagittars
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Selesnya Sagittars can block an additional creature each combat.
cards.flavor:
"What's their strike range, you ask? Let's put it this way: sagittars aim their bows using maps."
—Otak, Tin Street shopkeep
cards.originalText:
Selesnya Sagittars can block as though it had flying.
Selesnya Sagittars can block an additional creature.

cards.name: Shambling Shell
cards.text:
Sacrifice Shambling Shell: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)
cards.originalText:
Sacrifice Shambling Shell: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Sisters of Stone Death
cards.text:
{G}: Target creature blocks Sisters of Stone Death this turn if able.
{B}{G}: Exile target creature blocking or blocked by Sisters of Stone Death.
{2}{B}: Put a creature card exiled with Sisters of Stone Death onto the battlefield under your control.

rulings.text: The third ability can get back any creature card exiled by the second ability, no matter when it was exiled. If a card that's not a creature card (such as Svogthos, the Restless Tomb) was exiled, the third ability can't return it.

foreignNames.name: Sœurs de la mort de pierre

cards.originalText:
{G}: Target creature blocks Sisters of Stone Death this turn if able.
{B}{G}: Remove from the game target creature blocking or blocked by Sisters of Stone Death.
{2}{B}: Put a creature card removed from the game with Sisters of Stone Death into play under your control.

cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor:
"I do not know which gives me more pride: the legions of soldiers marching in thunderous lockstep, or the cry of the skyknights riding their rocs like jagged lightning overhead."
—Razia
cards.originalText: Flying, haste

cards.name: Sunhome Enforcer
cards.text:
Whenever Sunhome Enforcer deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
{1}{R}: Sunhome Enforcer gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Law soothed his savage heart. Where fury once burned, the enduring flame of order now shines."
—Razia
cards.originalText:
Whenever Sunhome Enforcer deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
{1}{R}: Sunhome Enforcer gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Szadek, Lord of Secrets
cards.text:
Flying
If Szadek, Lord of Secrets would deal combat damage to a player, instead put that many +1/+1 counters on Szadek and that player puts that many cards from the top of their library into their graveyard.

rulings.text: If another effect would prevent Szadek's combat damage from being dealt to the defending player or replace it with something else, that player chooses which effect applies first. For example, the player can choose to first have Mending Hands prevent 4 of the damage and then apply Szadek's ability so that it gets only one counter.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If Szadek, Lord of Secrets would deal combat damage to a player, instead put that many +1/+1 counters on Szadek and that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
